result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas Scott Braaten
Current: 205 1st Ave N Apt #2, Bayport, MN 55003 United States  (Effective: 10-25-2022)
Prior: 10890 Butternut St NW, Minneapolis, MN 55448 United States
Filed by DE. jaf

- AMENDED

- Includes 22CF445 & 22CF538

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sarah J.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:19 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nicholas Scott Braaten in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Nicholas Scott Braaten. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo not in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF445 & 22CF538. Court reviews files and bond modification between DE and Sarah J.  DE states he is sober and would be willing to take a test if needed.  Court questions Sarah J who is here in the courtroom.  Sarah J makes statements.  Court questions DE.  DE makes statements. Court orders DE to test now, if tests clean bond will be modified to NAC with Sarah J.  Adjourned at 1:24 PM.  OFF record at 1:46 PM-  JSC confirmed DE tested negative.  Per SRN- Amend bonds to NAC, includes 22CF445 & 22CF538. bph
for Atty Firkus to appear via zoom on 10/18. Includes 22CF445 and 22CF538. Filed by Atty Firkus. arc     Approved by SRN on 10-18-2022. JA will advise Atty. Firkus' Office
Filed by Atty. Firkus. kma    to rg

AMENDED

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sarah J.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

11:32 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nicholas Scott Braaten appeared by video.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Nicholas Scott Braaten.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews files.  Includes 22CF445 & 22CF538.  As to 22CF445- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG pleas entered on all 5 counts.  As to 22CF538- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Court reviews bond modification.  Ms. Stiz is here from JSC, states all tests have been negative since mid July. Court modifies bond. DE to come to Clerks office in the next week to sign new bond. Court does not modify bond to lift NC with S.J. at this time.  State to provide discovery within next 2 weeks, motions to be filed 2 weeks after that. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 11:42 AM. bph

4:01 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nicholas Scott Braaten in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Nicholas Scott Braaten.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF445 & 22CF538- both set for PH. Court reviews files. As to 22CF445-  S/T of Detective Joseph Kastens of NR PD.  Direct by ADA Ballo. Cross by Atty Firkus. Arguments by attorneys. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court questions DE as to why he has not paid his attorney fee payment. 
 DE states he'll have payment in by Monday 9/19/22.  Court modifies attorney payments to be due by the 15th of each month instead of the 1st.  Atty Firkus states 22CF538 will be PH waiver.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. DE updates and address and confirms phone number.  DE can appear by zoom for next hearing. Adjourned at 4:45 PM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
